text:
Hey all, a reminder theme field validation is going to be enabled for newly created themes this coming Monday: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CEQQ9NFK2/p1594740898198700>

If you have boilerplates you use to create new themes, or plan on creating new themes based off code you have in existing themes, it is worth making sure they pass validation.

Please do not hesitate to reach out if you have any issues or questions!

Trying to submit an update to a Theme in the marketplace and getting this error message. Any ideas? Guessing it’s related to the new Label field that is now in Modules, however the field says it Defaults to the module name if empty.
Are you setting labels for each module locally?
Not that I’m aware of <@U22PWJ41G> And the only difference we made between the last submission and this one was updating 1 line of CSS in one of the stylesheets.
We’ve been improving validation so that the themes delivered to customers are of the highest quality. The errors appear to state that you’re missing labels for 2 modules.
This says that if you don’t add a label then by default it’s the module name
But the error message above makes it seem as if I DO need to actually put a label in here.
You do need to. I recommend pulling your theme down locally and adding a `"label"` to the modules

No problem!
I realized I should have provided an example: <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/modules/card-section.module/meta.json#L2>
